meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an oligopsony.
meanings.sent1: The oligopsonistic behavior of the company led to limited options for suppliers.
meanings.sent2: The market structure was oligopsonistic, with only a few buyers controlling the prices.
meanings.sent3: It was quite oligopsonistic of the group to always choose the same supplier for their needs.
meanings.sent4: The oligopsonistic control over the market squeezed out competition.
meanings.sent5: The oligopsonistic nature of the industry made it difficult for new businesses to enter.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of an oligopsony.
meanings.sent1: Her oligopsonistic approach to negotiations favored large suppliers over small ones.
meanings.sent2: The oligopsonistic structure of the industry allowed buyers to dictate terms to sellers.
meanings.sent3: The team's oligopsonistic strategy in purchasing equipment raised eyebrows among competitors.
meanings.sent4: The company's oligopsonistic practices stifled competition in the market.
meanings.sent5: The oligopsonistic tendencies of the business were evident in its exclusive contracts.

meanings.sent1: The oligopsonistic company controlled the prices of raw materials in the market.
meanings.sent2: Their oligopsonistic behavior limited the choices available to suppliers.
meanings.sent3: It was quite oligopsonistic of the business to corner the market in such a way.
meanings.sent4: The oligopsonistic practices of the corporation impacted small businesses negatively.
meanings.sent5: The oligopsonistic operation of the industry created challenges for independent sellers.
